description: From Medieval Latin substantiatus (“given substance”), from the verb substantiare, first used 1657.

verbs.description: substantiate (third-person singular simple present substantiates, present participle substantiating, simple past and past participle substantiated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To verify something by supplying evidence; to authenticate or corroborate
(transitive) To give material form or substance to something; to embody; to record in documents
